phrase: エスカレーターが　ぎゃくだった
phrase_en: The escalator was going the opposite way.

phrase: アイスが　とけてきた
phrase_en: The ice cream started melting.

phrase: へんな　ひゃくを　した

phrase: たんじょうびケーキが　たおれて　イチゴが　ころがった

phrase: ごはんつぶを　ふんだ

phrase: おふろの　ごみが　すくえない
phrase_en: Can't scoop the debris out of the bathtub.

phrase: ふたが　ない
phrase_en: There is no lid.

phrase: テープの　はしが　みつからない

phrase: えだまめが　とんだ

phrase: カップめんの　おゆが　たりない

phrase: うんてんちゅうの　くるまの　なかに　おおきな　クモが　いる
phrase_en: There is a big spider in the car while driving.

phrase: ゆでたまごが　ボロボロ

phrase: ストローが　とれない

phrase: 「う」の　もじが　はんたいだった
phrase_en: The letter 'u' was backwards.

phrase: おちたけしゴムがみつからない

phrase: たんじょうびケーキがたおれそう

phrase: じゅうでんができていなかった

phrase: ケチャップがとんだ

phrase: ポケットからすながたくさんでてきた

phrase: いおうとしていたことをわすれた

phrase: ふくのピラピラがきになる
phrase_en: The loose thread on my clothes is bothering me.

phrase: しゅくだいノートとじゆうちょうをまちがえた

phrase: ふたがしまらない
phrase_en: The lid won't close.

phrase: めんつゆがすごくあまった
phrase_en: A lot of noodle dipping sauce was left over.

phrase: ながしのみずがスプーンではねた

phrase: べんざをあけたまますわった

phrase: アメリカンドッグがまわる

phrase: ねむれない
phrase_en: Can't sleep.

phrase: シャンプーがめにはいった

phrase: バッグのなかですいとうがもれた

phrase: なまえがおもいだせない
phrase_en: Can't remember the name.

phrase: きんじょのおばさんがずっとなまえをまちがえている
phrase_en: The neighborhood lady has been getting my name wrong for a long time.

phrase: おゆがない
phrase_en: There is no hot water.

phrase: ドアをあけられてさむい
phrase_en: Someone opened the door and it's cold.

phrase: せんせいのメガネがとんだ

phrase: ほねをとっていたらぐちゃぐちゃになった
phrase_en: It became a mess while I was trying to remove the bones.

phrase: ぎゅうにゅうがこぼれた

phrase: かさがうらがえった
phrase_en: The umbrella turned inside out.

phrase: じてんしゃがドミノだおし
phrase_en: The bicycles fell over like dominoes.

phrase: おもったよりみじかくなった
phrase_en: It became shorter than I thought.

phrase: ネコがついてくる
phrase_en: A cat is following me.

phrase: どしゃぶりなのにかさがない
phrase_en: It's pouring rain but I don't have an umbrella.

phrase: れいとうこがしまらない
phrase_en: The freezer won't close.

phrase: さようならのおじぎでランドセルのなかみがぜんぶでた
phrase_en: Everything fell out of my backpack when I bowed to say goodbye.

phrase: まいご
phrase_en: I'm lost.

phrase: かいものがながい
phrase_en: Shopping is taking a long time.

phrase: じてんしゃにハチがとまっている
phrase_en: A bee is sitting on the bicycle.

phrase: せんせいにおかあさんといってしまった

phrase: ギターのなかにおかしがおちた
phrase_en: A snack fell inside the guitar.

phrase: ズボンのゴムがきれた

phrase: さなぎからかえったカブトムシがよなかにだっそうしてとびまわっている
phrase_en: The beetle that emerged from its pupa escaped at night and is flying around.

phrase: けしゴムにさしたえんぴつのしんがけしたときにつく

phrase: おきられない

phrase: 電柱にじてんしゃでつっこんだ

phrase: トイレがつまった

phrase: おかあさんがイライラしている

phrase: プレゼントをわすれた

phrase: クモのすにかかった

phrase: しゃっくりがとまらない

phrase: わりばしがうまくわれない

phrase: おなかがすいてうごけない

phrase: まちがえてシャワーがでた

phrase: パンがくろこげ
phrase_en: The bread is burnt to a crisp.

phrase: けずりかすいれがはいってなかった
phrase_en: The pencil shavings container wasn't in.

phrase: ふとんのなかでおならがでた

phrase: じぶんのいえでトイレがつまった
phrase_en: The toilet at my own house is clogged.

phrase: あたまにつけたわゴムがとれない
phrase_en: Can't remove the rubber band I put on my head.

phrase: ビニールぶくろがめくれない

phrase: しょくばんをがんばってスライスしているうちにぺしゃんこになっていた
phrase_en: The bread got squashed while I was trying hard to slice it.

phrase: ペンがしみてつくえについた

phrase: やっぱりさむかった

phrase: トイレのかみがない

phrase: ワサビいりだった

phrase: ハエがじぶんにばかりとまる

phrase: イヌがすごくなめてくる

phrase: しらないひとのてをにぎっていた

phrase: シロツメクサのかんむりをよくみるとアブラムシだらけだった

phrase: バッグにアリがあつまってきた

phrase: しんしつのてんじょうのもくめがひとのかおにみえてきた

phrase: やすみじかんに　おいた　すいとうが　そのまま

phrase_en: Swallowed the gum; it still had a lot of flavor left.

phrase: むかしの　おにぎりが　でてきた

phrase: 正式国名 五十音順 アに近い
phrase_en: Official name closest to 'A' in Japanese syllabary.

phrase: 首都が最南
phrase_en: Southernmost capital.

phrase: いぬもあるけばぼうにあたる
phrase_en: Even a dog will hit a pole if it walks.

phrase: ろんよりしょうこ
phrase_en: Proof over theory.

phrase: はなよりだんご
phrase_en: Dumplings over flowers.

phrase: にをつくる
phrase_en: Making a smell.

phrase: ほねおりぞんのくたびれもうけ
phrase_en: Wasted effort and only exhaustion gained.

phrase: へをひってしりをすぼめる
phrase_en: Farting and then tightening the buttocks.

phrase: ちりもつもればやまとなる
phrase_en: Even dust when piled up becomes a mountain.

phrase: ちりはあくた
phrase_en: Dust is rubbish.

phrase: りくつをいう
phrase_en: Arguing logic.

phrase: ぬすびとをとらえてみればわがこなり
phrase_en: The thief caught turned out to be one's own child.

phrase: るいをもってあつまる
phrase_en: Like attracts like.

phrase: をもてなし
phrase_en: Hospitality.

phrase: わらうかどにはふくきたる
phrase_en: Fortune comes to those who laugh.

phrase: かってかぶとのををしめよ
phrase_en: Tighten your helmet strings after victory.

phrase: よのなかはみっかみぬまのさくらかな
phrase_en: The world is like cherry blossoms in a three-day dream.

phrase: たびはみちづれよはなさけ
phrase_en: In travel a companion in life kindness.

phrase: れいうをうるおい
phrase_en: Moistened by cold rain.

phrase: そんしてとくとれ
phrase_en: Lose to gain.

phrase: つきよにちょうちん
phrase_en: Lantern on a moonlit night.

phrase: ねるまもなし
phrase_en: No time even to sleep.

phrase: なくこにゃかてぬ
phrase_en: One cannot win against a crying child.

phrase: らくあればくあり
phrase_en: Where there is pleasure there is pain.

phrase: むりをすれば道理がひっこむ
phrase_en: Force will overcome reason.

phrase: うそつきはどろぼうのはじまり
phrase_en: Lying is the beginning of theft.

phrase: ゐのなかのかわずだいかいをしらず
phrase_en: A frog in a well knows nothing of the great ocean.

phrase: のどをすぎてあつさをわすれる
phrase_en: Forget the heat once it passes the throat.

phrase: おににかなぼう
phrase_en: A metal club for an ogre (Invincible).

phrase: くさいものにはふたをする
phrase_en: Put a lid on something smelly.

phrase: やすものがいのかにぜにうしない
phrase_en: Buy cheap waste money.

phrase: まけるがたち
phrase_en: Losing is winning.

phrase: げいはおみをたすく
phrase_en: Art saves the body.

phrase: ふみはやりたしのかくじなし
phrase_en: Want to send a letter but can't write.

phrase: こうかいさきにたたず
phrase_en: Regret comes too late.

phrase: えてにほをあげる
phrase_en: Hoist a sail in one's specialty.

phrase: てをあらう
phrase_en: Wash one's hands (of something).

phrase: あたまかくしてしりかくさず
phrase_en: Hide the head but not the tail.

phrase: さんにんよればもんじゅのちえ
phrase_en: Three people together have the wisdom of Monju.

phrase: きいてごくらくみてじごく
phrase_en: Paradise to hear hell to see.

phrase: ゆだんたいてき
phrase_en: Carelessness is a great enemy.

phrase: めはくちほどにものをいう
phrase_en: The eyes say as much as the mouth.

phrase: みからでたさび
phrase_en: Rust from one's own body (Reaping what you sow).

phrase: しらぬがほとけ
phrase_en: Ignorance is bliss.

phrase: ゑに描いた餅
phrase_en: A painted rice cake (Useless).

phrase: ひょうたんからこま
phrase_en: A horse from a gourd (Unexpected).

phrase: もんぜんのこぞうならぬきょうをよむ
phrase_en: An apprentice before a temple gate reads sutras unlearned.

phrase: せに腹はかえられぬ
phrase_en: Can't trade the back for the belly.

phrase: すめばみやこ
phrase_en: Home is where you make it.

phrase: きょうのゆめおおさかのゆめ
phrase_en: A dream of Kyoto a dream of Osaka.

phrase: あきのたの かりほのいおの とまをあらみ わがころもでは つゆにぬれつつ
phrase_en: In the autumn field, in the temporary hut's rough rush-mats, my sleeves are getting wet with dew.

phrase: あきかぜに たなびくくもの たえまより もれいづるつきの かげのさやけさ
phrase_en: Through the rifts in the clouds trailing in the autumn wind, how clear the moonlight leaks out.

phrase: あしびきの やまどりのをの しだりをの ながながしよを ひとりかもねむ
phrase_en: Must I sleep alone through the long, long night, like the long, trailing tail of the mountain pheasant?

phrase: あまのはら ふりさけみれば かすがなる みかさのやまに いでしつきかも
phrase_en: When I look out over the plain of heaven, is that the same moon that rose over Mount Mikasa in Kasuga?

phrase: あわれとも いうべきひとは おもほえで みのいたずらに なりぬべきかな
phrase_en: Since there is no one who might feel pity for me, I suppose I shall just pass away in vain.

phrase: いまはただ おもひたえなむ とばかりを ひとづてならで いうよしもがな
phrase_en: Now I just want to give up my love; if only I could tell you this directly and not through others.

phrase: いまこむと いいしばかりに ながつきの ありあけのつきを まちいでつるかな
phrase_en: Just because you said 'I'll come soon', I have waited until the morning moon of the long month appeared.

phrase: いろはにほへど ちりぬるを わがよたれぞ つねならむ
phrase_en: Though flowers are fragrant, they will fall; in our world, who can remain forever?

phrase: いのちながくは かたみにあはず ひとりして ものおもふよぞ ながかりける
phrase_en: If I live long, we might not meet again; the night I spend alone in thought is so very long.

phrase: いにしへの ならのみやこの やへざくら けふここのへに にほひぬるかな
phrase_en: The eight-layered cherry blossoms of the ancient capital of Nara are fragrantly blooming today in the imperial palace.

phrase: うかりける ひとをはつせの やまおろしよ はげしかれとは いのらぬものを
phrase_en: O mountain wind of Hatsuse, I did not pray for you to be so harsh, though she is cold to me.

phrase: うらみわび ほさぬそでだに あるものを こひにくちなむ なこそをしけれ
phrase_en: I resent her and am weary; my sleeves never dry, and I fear my reputation will rot away in this love.

phrase: えにしあらば あはむとぞおもふ いざさらば わがなとひとは わすれざらなむ
phrase_en: If there is fate, I believe we shall meet; now farewell, and may you not forget my name.

phrase: おおえやま いくののみちの とおければ まだふみもみず あまのはしだて
phrase_en: The road to Ikuno over Mount Oe is so far that I have seen neither a letter nor Amanohashidate.

phrase: おくやまに もみぢふみわけ なくしかの こゑきくときぞ あきはかなしき
phrase_en: When I hear the voice of the stag crying as he steps through the maple leaves deep in the mountains, autumn is truly sad.

phrase: かささぎの わたせるはしに おくしもの しろきをみれば よぞふけにける
phrase_en: When I see the white frost on the bridge the magpies are said to have spread, I know the night has deepened.

phrase: かぜをいたみ いはうつなみの おのれのみ くだけてものを おもふころかな
phrase_en: Like the waves breaking against the rocks in the fierce wind, I alone am broken as I think of my love.

phrase: きみがため はるののにいでて わかなつむ わがころもでに ゆきはふりつつ
phrase_en: For your sake, I went out to the spring fields to pick young greens, while snow fell on my sleeves.

phrase: きみがため をしからざりし いのちさへ ながくもがなと おもひけるかな
phrase_en: For your sake, I did not value my life, but now I wish it would be long.

phrase: くさもきも いろかはれども わたつみの なみのはなにぞ あきなかりける
phrase_en: Though the colors of plants and trees change, there is no autumn in the flowers of the sea waves.

phrase: くれなゐに みづくくるとは ききしかど あきぞこのはに まじりけるかな
phrase_en: I heard that the water is dyed crimson, but it seems autumn has mixed into the leaves.

phrase: こころあてに をらばやをらむ はつしもの おきまどはせる しらぎくのはな
phrase_en: If I were to pick them at random, I might pick the white chrysanthemums that the first frost has confused.

phrase: このたびは ぬさもとりあへず たむけやま もみぢのにしき かみのまにまに
phrase_en: At this time, I could not even bring an offering; let the gods take the brocade of maple leaves on Mount Tamuke.

phrase: さびしさに やどをたちいでて ながむれば いづこもおなじ あきのゆふぐれ
phrase_en: In my loneliness, I leave my house and look out; everywhere it is the same autumn evening.

phrase: しのぶれど いろにいでにけり わがこひは ものやおもふと ひとのとふまで
phrase_en: Though I try to hide it, my love shows in my face, until people ask if I am lost in thought.

phrase: すみのえの きしによるなみ よるさへや ゆめのかよひぢ ひとめよくらむ
phrase_en: Like the waves approaching the shore of Suminoe, even at night do you avoid people's eyes on the dream path?

phrase: せをはやみ いはにせかるる たきがはの われてもすゑに あはむとぞおもふ
phrase_en: Like the river current split by a rock in the rapids, though divided, I know we shall meet in the end.

phrase: そらしらぬ ゆきふみわけて いでつるは ひとつのえだに つるをたづねて
phrase_en: I went out treading through the snow I didn't know, seeking a vine on a single branch.

phrase: たごのうらに うちいでてみれば しろたへの ふじのたかねに ゆきはふりつつ
phrase_en: When I go out to the shore of Tago and look, snow is falling on the white peak of Mount Fuji.

phrase: ちはやぶる かみよもきかず たつたがは からくれなゐに みづくくるとは
phrase_en: Never heard of even in the age of the mighty gods, that the Tatsuta River is dyed in deep crimson.

phrase: つくばねの みねよりおつる みなのがは こひぞつもりて ふちとなりぬる
phrase_en: Like the Minano River falling from the peak of Tsukubane, my love has accumulated and become a deep pool.

phrase: てふことも いまはむかしに なりぬれば たがためにかは なにかうらみむ
phrase_en: Since even that has become a thing of the past, for whose sake should I hold any resentment?

phrase: ともしびを かきたつるまも なつかしき いづれのよひに みえぬまにまに
phrase_en: Even while trimming the lamp, I miss you; on which evening did I not see you?

phrase: ながからむ こころもしらず くろかみの みだれてけさは ものをこそおもへ
phrase_en: Uncertain of how long his heart will stay,my black hair lies in disarray this morning and so, I am lost in troubled thoughts.

phrase: にしきなる ふくろにいれて いはざかり いづれのやまを こえぬとぞおもふ
phrase_en: I put it in a brocade bag; I wonder which mountain it crossed in its peak of silence.

phrase: ぬさもとりあへず たむけやま もみぢのにしき かみのまにまに
phrase_en: I could not even bring an offering; let the gods take the brocade of maple leaves on Mount Tamuke.

phrase: ねがはくは はなのしたにて はるしなむ そのきさらぎの もちづきのころ
phrase_en: My wish is to die in spring under the flowers, around the time of the full moon in the second month.

phrase: のちのよを おもへばかろし ほととぎす あかつきかけて なきつるものを
phrase_en: Thinking of the afterlife makes it seem light, while the cuckoo cries toward the dawn.

phrase: はるすぎて なつきにけらし しろたへの ころもほすてふ あまのかぐやま
phrase_en: Spring has passed and summer seems to have come; white robes are said to be dried on the heavenly Mount Kagu.

phrase: ひさかたの ひかりのどけき はるのひに しづこころなく はなのちるらむ
phrase_en: On this spring day when the light is so calm, why do the cherry blossoms scatter with such unquiet hearts?

phrase: ふくからに あきのくさきの しをるれば むべやまかぜを あらしといふらむ
phrase_en: Since the autumn plants and trees wither as soon as it blows, it is no wonder the mountain wind is called a storm.

phrase: へにける いくよをかさね たまづさの ふみをひらけば こひぞつもりぬる
phrase_en: As I open the letter after many passing nights, my love has truly accumulated.

phrase: ほととぎす なきつるかたを ながむれば ただありあけの つきぞのこれる
phrase_en: When I look toward where the cuckoo cried, only the morning moon remains.

phrase: まつとしき たかしのはまの あまごろも ぬれにぞぬれし いろはかはらず
phrase_en: Waiting on the beach of Takashi, the fisher's robe got soaked and soaked, but its color remained unchanged.

phrase: みかのはら わきてながるる いづみがは いつみきとてか こひしかるらむ
phrase_en: Like the Izumi River flowing through the plain of Mika, when did I see you that I should love you so?

phrase: むらさめの つゆもまだひぬ まきのはに きりたちのぼる あきのゆふぐれ
phrase_en: Before the dew of the passing shower has dried on the fir leaves, the mist rises on an autumn evening.

phrase: めぐりあひて みしやそれとも わかぬまに くもがくれにし よはのつきかな
phrase_en: Meeting by chance, before I could even tell if it was you, you were hidden by clouds like the midnight moon.

phrase: ももしきや ふるきのきばの しのぶにも なほあまりある むかしなりけり
phrase_en: In the palace, even the ferns on the old eaves make me yearn for the past more than I can bear.

phrase: やすらはで ねなましものを さよふけて かたぶくまでの つきをみしかな
phrase_en: I should have gone to sleep without waiting; I watched the moon until it began to sink late at night.

phrase: ゆらのとを わたるふなびと かぢをたえ ゆくへもしらぬ こひのみちかな
phrase_en: Like a mariner crossing the Yura Strait with a lost oar, I know not where the path of my love leads.

phrase: よをこめて とりのそらねは はかるとも よにあふさかの せきはゆるさじ
phrase_en: Though you try to deceive with a bird's false cry in the dead of night, the gate of Osaka shall not let you pass.

phrase: らいしやうの いのちのはてを しらぬまに けふをかぎりと おもひけるかな
phrase_en: Not knowing the end of my life in the next world, I thought today would be the limit.

phrase: りくかぜの さむきにたへて みちのくの しのぶもぢずり たれゆゑにけむ
phrase_en: Enduring the cold land wind, for whose sake was the tangled print of Michinoku's Shinobu?

phrase: るりのつぼ いづれのひとも すむらむと こころをかけし いろはみえず
phrase_en: In the lapis lazuli jar where everyone might live, I cannot see the colors I set my heart on.

phrase: れいよりも こころをつくせ さくらばな ちりぬるのちも にほひをこそ
phrase_en: Exert your heart more than usual, cherry blossoms; even after you fall, leave your fragrance.

phrase: ろばたにて こまをつなぎて みるほどに はなぞちりける さくらかな
phrase_en: While tethering my horse by the roadside, the cherry blossoms were scattering.

phrase: わたのはら やそしまかけて こぎいでぬと ひとにはつげよ あまのつりぶね
phrase_en: Tell the people that I have rowed out over the wide sea toward the many islands, O fisher's boat.

phrase: をぐらやま みねのもみぢば こころあらば いまひとたびの みゆきまたなむ
phrase_en: O maple leaves on the peak of Mount Ogura, if you have a heart, wait for one more imperial visit.

phrase: んにゃくにしゅう つねのことばを うたにして こころをつたふ みちぞたふとき
phrase_en: Turning ordinary words into songs to convey the heart, the path is truly noble.
